ygData.subject: Pixie Strike  (Was: RE: Kelin`s Lucid Lullaby, how ot use?)
ygData.msgSnippet: I have managed to PS three mobs (CT gators) at once (out of necessity not planing).  I would pull them out of the general melee and then cycle from one to the
ygData.messageBody:
I have managed to PS three mobs (CT gators) at once (out of necessity not
planing). I would pull them out of the general melee and then cycle from
one to the next once I had them all lined up. That battle cemented my
belief that a warrior is a MUST in every party. The warrior in the group
tanked four of these things in row, it was an awesome sight :)

Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Craftsmen of Societus Argenti


>From: Greg Gillan <GGillan@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Kelin`s Lucid Lullaby, how ot use?
>Date: Wed, 15 Sep 1999 14:24:20 -0400
>
>From: Greg Gillan <GGillan@...>
>
>Pixie strike is a great song. I almost never used it when I first got it,
>but I'm really enjoying it now.
>My question is this, how on earth can you effectively use it on two mobs in
>the confusion of melee? I have enough trouble clicking on the one creature
>that my party isn't fighting, let alone trying to select back and forth
>between two. It would be really nice if we could dynamically assign hot
>keys to monsters, then just quickly hit the keys to toggle back and forth.
>Ah well, wishful thinking.
>
>
>Elwyn Heartstring
>Level 39 Bard
>Erollisi Marr
>
